page.title: 08 LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: We interviewed Mr Darby about what life was like in Bitterley a long time ago.First we asked him how old he was when he left school.He was 14 when he left school.His first job was cleaning boots and knives for Mr and Mrs Wheeler who are the grandparents of Mr and Mrs Wheeler who live at the Bitterly Court now.He got 14 shillings a week when he first started work.He started work at 7,30 in the morning and he worked for 8 and a half hours.At the time when Mr Darby worked at the court there were two gardeners lots of maids and ten other people who lived there.We asked Mr Darby what the Bitterley railway line was like.
